concise_definition: v. 提供, 能负担, 给予 (afford 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: To provide or make available something, especially an opportunity, benefit, or possibility, often as a result of a situation or condition.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由于某种情况或条件而提供或给予某物，尤指机会、好处或可能性。
definitions.example_en: The new policy afforded students greater flexibility in choosing their courses.
definitions.example_cn: 这项新政策为学生提供了更大的选课自由度。

definitions.explanation_en: To have sufficient financial means to pay for something; to be able to bear the cost of something (used primarily in negative or conditional contexts).
definitions.explanation_cn: 指有足够的经济能力支付某物；能够承担某物的费用（通常用于否定或条件句中）。
definitions.example_en: We couldn't afford to buy a new car after losing our jobs.
definitions.example_cn: 我们失业后负担不起买一辆新车。

definitions.explanation_en: To yield or produce something as a result, often used in formal or literary contexts to describe outcomes or consequences.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指作为结果产生或带来某物，常用于正式或文学语境中描述结果或后果。
definitions.example_en: The negotiations afforded a rare opportunity for dialogue between the two nations.
definitions.example_cn: 这场谈判为两国之间提供了难得的对话机会。

comparison.analysis: “Provided” (提供) 更中性、更直接，强调主动给予或供应某物，常用于正式或制度性语境，如“provided resources”。“Afforded” 则更强调因某种条件或情境而自然或间接地带来某物，常带有被动或结果性含义，语气更委婉。
“Offered” (提供/提议) 暗示主动呈现或建议，通常带有意愿或选择的成分，如“offer a job”。“Afforded” 不强调主动意图，而是强调客观条件使某事成为可能，如“the situation afforded us time to think”。

“Enable” (使能够) 强调赋予能力或条件，使某人能完成某事，如“technology enables remote work”。“Afforded” 更侧重于结果的给予，而非能力的赋予。例如，“The scholarship afforded her the chance to study abroad” 强调机会被给予，而 “The scholarship enabled her to study abroad” 强调她因此有能力去实现。
